definition: Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
(classical) a type of battle-ax/to kill/to slaughter
surname Liu
few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom
young
odd (number)
strange/odd/weird/wonderful/surprisingly/unusually

sentences.english: Now in front of us we can see Comrade Liu Shaoqi's former residence.
sentences.chinese: 大家现在看到的是刘少奇同志旧居。

sentences.english: Liu Shaoqi was very good at economic construction and Party's construction.
sentences.chinese: 刘少奇同志最擅长经济建设和党建工作。

sentences.english: Comrade Liu Shaoqi made this clear in his report.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题，在刘少奇同志的报告中已经讲了。

definition: Zhou Enlai (1898-1976), Chinese communist leader, prime minister 1949-1976
Mao Zedong (1893-1976), Chinese communist leader
Hu Yaobang (1915-1989), Chinese politician
Yang Shangkun (1907-1998), former president of PRC and military leader
Zhu De (1886-1976), communist leader and founder of the People's Liberation Army
Dong Biwu (1886-1975), one of the founders of the Chinese communist party
Deng Xiaoping (1904-1997), Chinese communist leader, de facto leader of PRC 1978-1990 and creator of "socialism with Chinese characteristics"
Chairman Mao/Mao Zedong 毛澤東|毛泽东 (1893-1976), Chinese Communist leader
Li Fuchun (1900-1975), communist politician
Zhang Wentian (1900-1976), CCP party leader and theorist
Li Xiannian (1909-1992), PRC general and politician
Premier Zhou Enlai 周恩來|周恩来 (1898-1976)
Peng Zhen (1902-1997), Chinese communist leader
Hua Guofeng (1921-2008), leader of Chinese Communist Party after the Cultural Revolution
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972

Peng Dehuai (1898-1974), top communist general, subsequently politician and politburo member, disgraced after attacking Mao's failed policies in 1959, and died after extensive persecution during the Cultural Revolution
